level.text: Except as otherwise provided in subsection (b) of this section, a statutory trust may be formed for and may have any lawful purpose, regardless of whether for profit.
A statutory trust may not have a predominantly donative purpose.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-210 added "regardless of whether for profit" at the end of (a); and substituted "may" for "shall" in (b).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 18-378
level.text: For history of Law 18-378, see notes under § 29-101.01.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Uniform Law: This section is based on § 303 of the Uniform Statutory Trust Entity Act.
Application of Law 19-210: Section 7 of D.C. Law 19-210 provided that the act shall apply as of January 1, 2012.
